vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
νηστ-εία, ἡ,
fast, νηστεῖαι καὶ ὁρταί [NT+5th c.BC+]; νηστείας ὄζειν [Refs 4th c.BC+]; at Athens, name for the third day of the Thesmophoria, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
fasting, going without food
fasting, want of food, 2Cor. 6:5; 11:27; a fast, religious abstinence from food, Mt. 17:21; Lk. 2:37; specifically the annual public fast of the Jews, the great day of atonement, occurring in the month Tisri, corresponding to the new moon of October, Acts 27:9*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: ayuno, pasar sin comida como un deber religioso ; hambre, inanición ; el ayuno (del día del Perdón HCH.27:9)
